intro: Styphelia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, arranged in dense clusters. Styphelia papuana thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests or heathlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the unique flora of its native habitat.
